Pre-Game Insights: Sacramento Kings are looking to continue their three-game win streak with a victory against Golden State Warriors.
The Warriors are 1-5 in division play and 1-3 in one-possession games.
The Kings are 2-6 against the rest of their division and have a 2-6 record in one-possession games.
The Warriors are shooting 45.0% from the field this season, which is 1.6 percentage points lower than the 46.6% the Kings allow to opponents.
The Kings are shooting 47.6% from the field, which is 2.4% higher than the 45.2% the Warriors' opponents have shot this season.
Stephen Curry is averaging 22.3 points and 6.5 assists for the Warriors.
Domantas Sabonis is averaging 20.5 points, 13.7 rebounds, and 6.1 assists for the Kings.

In their last 10 games, the Warriors have a record of 4-6, averaging 111.3 points, 42.9 rebounds, 28.7 assists, 8.2 steals, and 5.8 blocks per game while shooting 44.1% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 115.4 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Kings have a record of 4-6, averaging 113.0 points, 45.1 rebounds, 26.4 assists, 8.1 steals, and 4.2 blocks per game while shooting 45.2% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 116.3 points.
Injuries for the Warriors include Stephen Curry (day to day, knee), Brandin Podziemski (day to day, abdominal), Gary Payton II (day to day, calf), and Jonathan Kuminga (day to day, ankle).
Injuries for the Kings include Keegan Murray (day to day, ankle) and De'Aaron Fox (day to day, hip).
